Generation I.Red: Puts enemies to sleep then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating bad dreams.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Puts enemies to sleep then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating bad dreams.
Generation I.Yellow: If you sleep by it all the time, it will sometimes show you dreams it has eaten in the past.
Generation I.Stadium: It puts its enemy to sleep and eats the victim's dreams. Said to have descended from the legendary beast, Baku .

Generation II.Gold: If you think that you had a good dream, but you can't remember it, a Drowzee has probably eaten it.
Generation II.Silver: It remembers every dream it eats. It rarely eats the dreams of adults because children's are much tastier.
Generation II.Crystal: When it twitches its nose, it can tell where someone is sleeping and what that person is dreaming about.
Generation II.Stadium 2: If you think that you had a good dream, but you can't remember it, a Drowzee has probably eaten it. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) It remembers every dream it eats. It rarely eats the dreams of adults because children's are much tastier. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: If your nose becomes itchy while you are sleeping, it's a sure sign that one of these Pok é mon is standing above your pillow and trying to eat your dream through your nostrils.
Generation III.Sapphire: If your nose becomes itchy while you are sleeping, it's a sure sign that one of these Pok é mon is standing above your pillow and trying to eat your dream through your nostrils.
Generation III.Emerald: If your nose becomes itchy while you are sleeping, it's a sure sign that a Drowzee is standing above your pillow and trying to eat your dream through your nostrils.
Generation III.FireRed: A descendent of the legendary animal baku, which is said to eat dreams. It is skilled at hypnotism.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Puts enemies to sleep, then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating only bad dreams.

Generation IV.Diamond: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.
Generation IV.Pearl: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.
Generation IV.Platinum: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.
Generation IV.HeartGold: If you think that you had a good dream but you can't remember it, a Drowzee has probably eaten it.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It remembers every dream it eats. It rarely eats the dreams of adults because children's are much tastier.

Generation V.Black: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.
Generation V.White: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.
Generation V.Black 2: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.
Generation V.White 2: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.

Generation VI.X: Puts enemies to sleep, then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating only bad dreams.
Generation VI.Y: If you think that you had a good dream but you can't remember it, a Drowzee has probably eaten it.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: If your nose becomes itchy while you are sleeping, it's a sure sign that one of these Pokémon is standing above your pillow and trying to eat your dream through your nostrils.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: If your nose becomes itchy while you are sleeping, it's a sure sign that one of these Pokémon is standing above your pillow and trying to eat your dream through your nostrils.

Generation VII.Sun: A Pokémon that nourishes itself by eating dreams, it is thought to share common ancestry with Munna and Musharna .
Generation VII.Moon: It finds really fun dreams tasty. When it makes friends with people, it may show them the most delicious dreams it's ever eaten.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It can be spotted near recreational facilities, intending to eat the pleasant dreams of children who enjoyed themselves there that day.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It puts its prey to sleep and devours their dreams. It seems that bad dreams taste sour, so Drowzee doesn't particularly like eating them.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: If you sleep by it all the time, it will sometimes show you dreams it had eaten in the past.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: If you sleep by it all the time, it will sometimes show you dreams it had eaten in the past.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It remembers every dream it eats. It rarely eats the dreams of adults because children’s are much tastier.
Generation IX.Violet: When it twitches its nose, it can tell where someone is sleeping and what that person is dreaming about.

Generation IV.HeartGold: Routes 11 , 34 , and 35 Safari Zone Night (tall grass in Swamp, default)
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Routes 11 , 34 , and 35 Safari Zone Night (tall grass in Swamp, default)

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Route 215 ( Swarm ) Grand Underground - Dazzling Cave , Stargleam Cavern (After obtaining the National Pokédex )
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Route 215 ( Swarm ) Grand Underground - Dazzling Cave , Stargleam Cavern (After obtaining the National Pokédex )
